results.title: A Day in the death of Joe Egg
results.creator_credit: Peter Medak, David Deutsch, Domino and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Alan Bates and Janet Suzman give exceptional performances in this unforgettable story. Based on the play by Peter Nichols, it centres around Bri and Sheila, an English couple struggling to cope with and raise their only child - a severely handicapped young girl named Jo with whom they cannot communicate. Much to the dismay of friends and relatives, who continually recommend having Jo institutionalised, the couple choose to care for their daughter in their own modest apartment. Although they try to maintain their sense of humour, the difficulty and the seeming futility of their efforts takes an emotional toll that eventually threatens to destroy their marriage. A vivid portrait of two caring individuals faced with an almost impossible situation.

results.title: A Dangerous life
results.creator_credit: R. Markowitz, Hal McElroy and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the four day revolution in the Philippines. Told through the eyes of a television reporter and photojournalist, it backgrounds the struggle that led to the 1986 revolution which saw Aquino become president succeeding the ousted Ferdinand Marcos.
results.creator_credit_for_label: R. Markowitz, Hal McElroy and McElroy & McElroy

results.title: A Crowded wilderness
results.creator_credit: Grant Kennedy, Roger Hart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Spacious, limitless as they may seem, Canada’s National Parks may not be able to keep up with the demands made on their resources without a continuing program of extending the parks system. Wilderness may, in fact, be the greatest heritage this generation of Canadians can leave to future generations. The problems, and the need to act now, are well defined in this film by concerned conservationists.

results.title: A Crime to fit the punishment
results.brief_description: In 1954, during the height of McCarthyism and the Cold War, the controversial labour film ‘Salt of the Earth’ was made despite numerous attempts by the film industry and the U.S. government to prevent its production. This film explores the background that surrounded the film’s production, combining interviews and production footage with newsclips and broadcasts from the early fifties. It captures the struggle of the blacklisted Hollywood film people who defiantly set out to commit a crime to fit their punishment. Narrated by Lee Grant.

results.title: A Continent on guard
results.creator_credit: Bob Walker, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Presents a dramatic, simulated investigation into a suspected outbreak of foot and mouth disease in Australia, and points out what measures would be taken to eradicate the disease. Note: A complementary production to ‘The constant threat’

results.title: A Country practice: the wedding
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, Lynn Bayonas and JNP Films
results.brief_description: Television soaps are famous for their elaborate funerals, births and weddings, and long-running Australian favourite “A Country Practice” was no different. This episode features the long awaited wedding of city doctor Simon Bowen to local vet Vicky Dean. Between last minute patient emergencies and an injured horse requiring urgent attention, locals wonder - will Simon and Vicky make it to the church on time?

results.title: A Composition in steel by Todd Pendleton with Jack Pendleton
results.creator_credit: James Klebau and James Klebau Productions
results.brief_description: The film shows the two Pendleton brothers, Todd and Jack, making a steel sculpture starting from the initial design in chalk on a metal base, then the selection, cutting and the beating of the scrap metal to shape. Finally they weld the shapes together modifying the design as they go.

results.title: A City in the country: Albury Wodonga development
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: With forty-two percent of the Australia’s population in Sydney and Melbourne, there is a need for decentralization. Because of this, the government has acted to create a new growth area near the border of Victoria and New South Wales. This film studies the many factors involved in planning a new community.

results.title: A Cosmic christmas
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Nelvana and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: An animated film in which a small town rediscovers the real spirit of Christmas thanks to three alien visitors from outer space and a little boy named Peter. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: A Chord for voices
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Malcolm Otton, OTC Australia and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In July 1976 a new undersea communications link was completed between Papua New Guinea, Australia and the rest of the world. Complicated cable laying techniques are shown, and in the background is the exotic and beautiful Papua New Guinea scenery. By plugging in to the international community, the indigenous people will feel greater pressure to surrender their traditions and customs, and to develop towards a more cosmopolitan way of life. Suitable for upper secondary level.
